page.title: 15 Health Care in Keith
page.content: The hospital in Keith is called Turner Memorial Hospital.It was first opened in 1880 after several years of fund raising.It originally had 4 wards,but has since been added to.In 1985,it has space for 31 patients-5 maternity,8 geriatric and 18 general.Nearly all operations are carried out in Elgin or Aberdeen,and there are 2 ambulances which take patients to and from hospital and answer emergency calls.The maternity unit is under threat of closure at the present and in future, mothers-to-be may have to go to Elgin or Aberdeen to have their babies. A new Health Centre was opened in 1969.At present,there are 4 full time doctors and 1 part-time who take regular surgeries as well as visiting patients in their homes.There are 2 full time district nurses,2 treatment room nurses and 5 receptionists.
